moves.1. Nc3 Nc6 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Ne5 Ne4 4. Nxc6: I decide to attack the f pawn...
moves.8... f6: ...but my opponent is wise to it.
moves.12... Ba6 13. f4 b4 14. fxe5 Bxd3 15. ex: I'm using this pawn as an attacker; it's now accounted for two, and I see a potential opening here...
moves.15... gxf6: This actually created the opening for my black square bishop.
moves.22... Kc7 23. Rxa8: ...which went the same way as its twin.
moves.23... Bh6+ 24. Kc2 Be4+ 25. Kb2: My king needed a place to hide here.
moves.25... Kb7 26. Re8 Bd3 27. Rd1 Bb5 28. Rx: I could afford to lose a rook...
moves.32... Ba6 33. Bc4: ...and my remaining one attacks the other.
moves.33... Kb6 34. Rxa6+: I now have a complete stranglehold...
moves.34... Kc5 35. Ra5+ Kd6 36. Rh5 c5 37. Rx: ...and take another pawn for good measure...
moves.37... Ke5 38. a4 Ke4 39. a5 f5 40. a6 f4: ...so decide to push one of mine...

gameName: No queens or knights... how will you do? II
